docs.title: Welcome!
docs.text: This is the first & only student-run wiki of Community Psychology

docs.title: What is Community Psychology?
docs.text: Community Psychologists consider how communities impact the well-being of people.

docs.title: Some things we consider are:
docs.text:
• the well-being of communities (empowerment, activism, & social justice)
  • how communities shape the well-being of people <---> how people shape the well-being of communities (ecological models, relationships, healing)
  • what people understand about their own well-being & the well-being of their communities (participatory action research methods)
  • how people define and relate to their communities (diversity, marginalisation, cultural humility)

docs.title: Common ideas that Community Psychologists build upon:
docs.text:
• liberation psychology
  • pedagogies of the oppressed
  • intersectionality (& Black feminist theories)
  • social & feminist models of disability
  • transnational feminism
  • critical race theories
  • arts-based methodologies
  • social constructivism
  • ecological systems models
  • praxis
  • reflexivity

docs.title: Quick links to learn more
docs.text:
1. Read more at the Society for Community Research and Action (SCRA)'s informational website:

    • CommunityPsychology.com

  2. Access a free, online book introducing the field:

    • Introduction to Community Psychology: Becoming an Agent of Change, by Leonard A. Jason; Olya Glantsman; Jack F. O'Brien; and Kaitlyn N. Ramian (Editors).

docs.title: Can I contribute to this wiki?
docs.text:
Yes!

Check out our contribution page to learn how!

docs.title: What is this place?
docs.text:
This is a wiki space where community psychology students & early-career professionals can build a repository of resources and knowledge relevant to our field and practice.

Check out our Discord to stay connected!

docs.title: How to Contribute to this Wiki
Method 1: Share with us on Discord
docs.text:
1. Find us on Discord and share your resources!
  2. The time frame for migrating resources shared in this way may be a little longer, however it is a great way to start a discussion.

docs.title: Method 2: Share in Github Discussions
docs.text:
1. You can share your ideas or resources in our Github Discussion Board.
  2. The time frame for migrating suggestions, or responding to them (in case of a problem), is 72 hours to 1 week.

docs.title: Method 3: Craft a Markdown Page in our wiki contribution space
docs.text:
1. Add a page to our Github-based wiki (we can migrate to the website)
  2. Directions are in the link above. We will want to meet with you virtually to check that you are human and will use the space appropriately.
  3. Once added, your contributions to the github wiki space will go live immediately and be migrated to the website in 72 hours to 1 week.

docs.title: Push changes directly to the website
docs.text:
1. Join us as a Github collaborator and add directly to the website!
  2. Contact us on Discord or in the Github Discussion Board to initiate the process for joining.
  3. We will want to meet with you virtually to confirm that you are human and will use the site appropriately.
  4. Any pushed changes will need to be approved and checked for any issues in the code.
  5. This site uses Markdown.
